New Records: Lionel Messi scored his 109th international goal and first of the tournament.
Messi has 28 goals in his past 25 matches for Argentina and 14 in Copa America play, three shy of the record.
Key Match Events: Julián Álvarez put Argentina ahead in the 22nd minute.
Lionel Messi redirected Enzo Fernández's shot in off goalkeeper Maxime Crépeau in the 51st minute.
Canada star Alphonso Davies limped off after his right leg was caught in a clean challenge with Gonzalo Montiel and was replaced in the 71st minute.
Jonathan David was thwarted by Emiliano Martínez from close range in first-half stoppage time.
Martínez made a kick save on Tani Oluwaseyi in the 80th minute.
Post-Match Reflections: Lionel Messi said, 'It's insane what this team has done, what the Argentina national team is doing.'

Stephen Eustaquio told Canadian broadcaster TSN, 'They're the best team in the world, but at the same time we had our chances in the beginning of the game. If we scored one of our chances, the story of the game would probably have been different.'
Eustaquio added, 'To get here, the last four of the Copa America, it's a big achievement.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The crowd of 80,102 on a night with an 82 degree temperature and 82% humidity was overwhelmingly pro-Argentina.
MetLife's temporary grass surface appeared heavy, with water splashing and sand popping up during dribbles.
Argentina extended its unbeaten streak to 10 games.
Argentina fans gathered in Times Square on the eve of the match and filled the streets of Manhattan before heading to MetLife Stadium.
